nodes.bodyText: missing @param environment
added.
move to parent class.
should clientId and environment be private since they have getters?
made private.
Environment variable IMDS_ENDPOINT is never used in ArcIdentityCredential, is that normal?
If so - what's the value for?

Currently, its just used to determine the Arc Env.
After discussing with @catalinaperalta , she mentioned we won't try auth with their IMDS endpoint.
We use the IDENTITY_ENDPOINT for auth req.
This is correct we only use IMDS_ENDPOINT as a signal to indicate that were on an Arc host.

If managedIdentityServiceCredential is null, getToken() method throws an exception. So, why not throw that exception here itself? Why delay throwing exception until later? Since this is final it won't change after the constructor is called anyway.

yeah, this is by design.
We don't throw exceptions beyond user input validation at build/construction level.
DefaultAzureCredential will start to break at the construction level too, which shouldn't happen and this will be a breaking change as well.
This can potentially throw NPE if managedIdentityServiceCredential is null. So, as mentioned above, it might be better to just throw an exception in ctor itself if it's null.
udpated
Where is this scanner used? s is overwritten on line 810 before it's used. Also, update the variable name to scanner to make it more readable.
If the status is 410, do we expect to swallow the exception and continue?

you mean 401,
yes we are expected to swallow it and read the response.
Yeah, I meant 401. In that case, can we add a logger to indicate that we ignored this exception?
Should the connection be closed here before throwing the exception?
added it to finally block.
openConnection() and connect() can throw exceptions too. We should wrap this in a try-finally block to clean up the connection in case of failures.
updated.
